title: LoL start sound is WAY too loud
body: It's been loud for a long time but seems even worse lately. I shouldn't have to turn down my audio system drastically for this one instance when everything else is fine.

replies.body:
Hey Guys!

In the upper right hand corner of the Launcher you will see a small gear icon. This is for the Launcher - not the Client - so before you hit the "Launch" button.

If you click on the gear icon you will get the option to turn down launcher SFX - this will also turn down the volume of the "Launcher is done patching sound). 

Hope this helps!

> [{quoted}](name=Utora,realm=NA,application-id=aAJWt2b9,discussion-id=A90hcb8a,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-11T00:07:50.432+0000)
>
> Hey Guys!
> 
> In the upper right hand corner of the Launcher you will see a small gear icon. This is for the Launcher - not the Client - so before you hit the "Launch" button.
> 
> If you click on the gear icon you will get the option to turn down launcher SFX - this will also turn down the volume of the "Launcher is done patching sound). 
> 
> Hope this helps!

That's good to know, but it seems like the default volume for the login sound and login music should be reduced. Right now, it really is jarringly loud. Strange as it may sound, I think reducing the default volume would actually get more people listening to the music, because fewer people would go "SWEET TEEMO THAT IS LOUD" and immediately hit the "disable login music" button.

Have you tried doing some informal tests, comparing the decibel levels of, say, a typical YouTube music video (at max volume) to the login screen music? When my computer is set to a volume that works well for other applications, I find that LoL still comes on deafeningly loud. I might be wrong, but I've heard enough people make jokes about how incredibly loud the LoL login music is that I think there really is a difference.

> [{quoted}](name=CupcakeTrap,realm=NA,application-id=aAJWt2b9,discussion-id=A90hcb8a,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-03-11T01:40:32.492+0000)
>
> ...but I've heard enough people make jokes about how incredibly loud the LoL login music is that I think there really is a difference.

I try.

Youtube videos are the quietest thing ever though. Max volume should be deafeningly loud IMO, not the volume you normally play things at. Youtube max volume is barely audible through any other sounds.

> [{quoted}](name=Mandaari,realm=NA,application-id=aAJWt2b9,discussion-id=A90hcb8a,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-03-11T03:59:58.998+0000)
>
> Youtube videos are the quietest thing ever though. Max volume should be deafeningly loud IMO, not the volume you normally play things at. Youtube max volume is barely audible through any other sounds.

So I just tried it out. Actually, for me, both the login music and YouTube at max volume was also deafeningly loud. I think what's going on is that Netflix is super, super quiet, so I have my system turned up really high.

Still, given that there's no obvious volume control for the login music (you have to go into a menu to find it), whereas YouTube has a convenient volume slider, I think there's an argument to be made for setting LoL's default in the midrange rather than max volume. If you took away YouTube's volume slider, I think it'd probably be better for it to default to 50% than 100%.

League of Legends music is historically very loud, YouTube audio is presented as each video's audio is uploaded to them (They do not alter audio streams beyond audio codec compression) and Netflix I'd expect would do the same. Unlike music, there is a standard volume movies typically adhere to, which, compared to "louder is better" music, is much, much lower in overall volume, and has oodles of dynamic range. I like dynamic range if you didn't know.
It's fine for everyone else. You do realize you can disable it, right? Also, you can turn your sound down. It won't hurt you.
It's not fine for everyone else. Just look at the boards and no, as far as I can find there is no setting to turn off that initial sound application startup sound.
This guy turns it up to 11, see?

I am looking at the boards... and I'm not seeing anyone else with the problem you have. Mostly because they managed to find their volume control.

I'll help you. When you click play, the client loads and you'll see DJ Sona. Near the Riot logo at the bottom left, there are 2 option boxes: one to disable login music and the other to disable animations. Click the top box. Poof.

EDIT: Oh, hey, look at that. One other person can't find their volume control.

Well, you are right and wrong Voidac. The process you described in not for the launch sound but there is a settings gear before you hit launch to does turn that sound down. Thanks to Utora for pointing that out, I've never seen it.
I thought you were talking about the DJ Sona music, not the sound upon hitting launch. Oh well.
